DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Action Relationship Type Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the kind of action taken for the adverse event. EXAMPLE(S): action taken was study treatment related, action taken was not study treatment related

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Action Relationship Type Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A thing done.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A thing done.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
